issue.title: feat(desktop): Style resize handles with visual feedback

successCriteria.criterion: Handles are nearly invisible/subtle by default
Handles show grip indicator on hover
Smooth CSS transitions between all states
Cursor changes to col-resize on handle

phases.title: Implement resize handle visual states
phases.summary: Updated layout.css with complete resize handle styling: (1) Base state now transparent instead of semi-visible, (2) Hover state shows grip indicator using ::before pseudo-element with radial-gradient dots and subtle blue background, (3) Active/dragging state uses solid #60a5fa via [data-resize-handle-active] selector, (4) Smooth 0.15s transitions on background and opacity. Build verified successful.
phases.content:
Update the `.resize-handle` CSS in layout.css to implement:

1. **Base state**: Make handles more subtle/transparent (currently rgba 0.1, should be near-transparent)

2. **Hover state**: Add a grip indicator using CSS pseudo-elements (::before) to show vertical dots or lines that indicate draggability. Keep the subtle blue background.

3. **Active/dragging state**: Use the `[data-resize-handle-active]` attribute selector that react-resizable-panels provides to style the active dragging state with the full accent color #60a5fa.

4. **Transitions**: Ensure smooth transitions for background, opacity, and any transform properties.

The grip indicator pattern should use 3 small dots or lines vertically centered in the handle.
verification: Resize handles are barely visible when not interacting
Hovering over a handle shows a grip indicator (dots or lines)
While actively dragging, handle shows solid accent color #60a5fa
Transitions are smooth between all states (no jarring changes)
Cursor shows col-resize when over handle

phases.title: Visual verification and refinement
phases.summary: Visual verification passed. User confirmed all resize handle states work correctly: transparent base state, grip indicator on hover, solid accent color when dragging, smooth transitions.
phases.content:
Build the app and visually verify all resize handle states work correctly:

1. Run `npm run dev` or build the desktop app
2. Test hover state on both resize handles (sidebar-main and main-detail)
3. Test active dragging state
4. Verify transitions are smooth
5. Make any minor CSS adjustments needed for visual polish

This phase may be skipped if Phase 1 verification passes on first attempt.
